intro: Diplomorpha yakushimensis, commonly known as the Yakushimense Diplomorpha, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
